Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black-figure 'overlap' decoration consisting of female figure (part of head and face in added white, himation in added red and jewellery in white remaining) and nude male (upper body with red for hair, baldric in white and left hand remaining), both to left; traces of another figure at right; ancient repair hole at top of sherd on woman's head and part of second at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 375, no. B515)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0397) (Phase 1)
